member.name: M:Vonage.Accounts.IAccountClient.GetAccountBalanceAsync(Vonage.Request.Credentials)
member.summary: Retrieve the current balance of your Vonage API account

member.name: M:Vonage.Accounts.IAccountClient.TopUpAccountBalanceAsync(Vonage.Accounts.TopUpRequest,Vonage.Request.Credentials)
member.summary: You can top up your account using this API when you have enabled auto-reload in the dashboard. The amount added by the top-up operation will be the same amount as was added in the payment when auto-reload was enabled. Your account balance is checked every 5-10 minutes and if it falls below the threshold and auto-reload is enabled, then it will be topped up automatically. Use this endpoint if you need to top up at times when your credit may be exhausted more quickly than the auto-reload may occur.

member.name: M:Vonage.Accounts.IAccountClient.ChangeAccountSettingsAsync(Vonage.Accounts.AccountSettingsRequest,Vonage.Request.Credentials)
member.summary: Update the default callback URLs (where the webhooks are sent to) associated with your account: * Callback URL for incoming SMS messages * Callback URL for delivery receipts Note: that the URLs you provide must be valid and active. Vonage will check that they return a 200 OK response before the setting is saved

member.name: M:Vonage.Accounts.IAccountClient.RetrieveApiSecretsAsync(System.String,Vonage.Request.Credentials)
member.summary: Many of Vonage's APIs are accessed using an API key and secret. It is recommended that you change or "rotate" your secrets from time to time for security purposes. This section provides the API interface for achieving this. Note: to work on secrets for your secondary accounts, you may authenticate with your primary credentials and supply the secondary API keys as URL parameters to these API endpoints.

member.name: T:Vonage.Applications.Capabilities.Voice.VoiceWebhook
member.summary: Represents a webhook for Voice API.
member.param: Must be one of GET or POST.

If Vonage can't connect to the webhook URL for this specified amount of time, then Vonage makes one additional attempt to connect to the webhook endpoint. This is an integer value specified in milliseconds.

If a response from the webhook URL can't be read for this specified amount of time, then Vonage makes one additional attempt to read the webhook endpoint. This is an integer value specified in milliseconds.

member.summary: Represents a webhook for Voice API.

member.summary: Close the room after a session ends. Only relevant for long_term rooms.

member.summary: The time for when the room will be expired. Required only for long-term room creation.

member.name: P:Vonage.Meetings.CreateRoom.CreateRoomRequest.JoinApprovalLevel
member.summary: The level of approval needed to join the meeting in the room. When set to "after_owner_only" the participants will join the meeting only after the host joined. When set to "explicit_approval" the participants will join the waiting room and the host will deny/approve them.

member.name: P:Vonage.Meetings.CreateRoom.CreateRoomRequest.Metadata

member.name: P:Vonage.Messages.Messenger.MessengerRequestData.Category
member.summary: The use of different category tags enables the business to send messages for different use cases. For Facebook Messenger they need to comply with their Messaging Types policy. Vonage maps our category to their messaging_type. If message_tag is used, then an additional tag for that type is mandatory. By default Vonage sends the response category to Facebook Messenger.

member.name: P:Vonage.Messages.Viber.ViberRequestData.Category
member.summary: The use of different category tags enables the business to send messages for different use cases. For Viber Service Messages the first message sent from a business to a user must be personal, informative and a targeted message - not promotional. By default Vonage sends the transaction category to Viber Service Messages.

member.name: P:Vonage.Messaging.SendSmsRequest.Ttl
member.summary: The duration in milliseconds the delivery of an SMS will be attempted. By default Vonage attempt delivery for 72 hours, however the maximum effective value depends on the operator and is typically 24 - 48 hours. We recommend this value should be kept at its default or at least 30 minutes.

member.summary: Does number exist. unknown means the number could not be validated. valid means the number is valid. not_valid means the number is not valid. inferred_not_valid means that the number could not be determined as valid or invalid via an external system and the best guess is that the number is invalid. This is applicable to mobile numbers only.

member.name: T:Vonage.NumberInsightV2.FraudCheck.FraudCheckResponse
member.summary: Represents the response of a Fraud Check request.
member.param: Unique UUID for this request for reference.
The type of lookup used in the request. Currently always phone.
An object containing at least the phone number that was used in the fraud check. If fraud_score was also requested and successful, other phone information (carrier and type) will be returned.
The result of the fraud_score insight operation. The fraud_score object will only be returned if you specified fraud_score as a value in the insights array when the request was made.

The result of the sim_swap insight operation. If successful, it will return swapped: true if the sim was swapped in the last 7 days. The sim_swap object will only be returned if you specified sim_swap as a value in the insights array when the request was made.

member.summary: Use Verify search to check the status of past or current verification requests

member.name: M:Vonage.Verify.IVerifyClient.VerifyControlAsync(Vonage.Verify.VerifyControlRequest,Vonage.Request.Credentials)
member.summary: Control the progress of your Verify requests. To cancel an existing Verify request, or to trigger the next verification event

member.name: M:Vonage.Verify.IVerifyClient.VerifyRequestWithPSD2Async(Vonage.Verify.Psd2Request,Vonage.Request.Credentials)
member.summary: Use Verify request to generate and send a PIN to your user to authorize a payment: 1. Create a request to send a verification code to your user. 2. Check the status field in the response to ensure that your request was successful (zero is success). 3. Use the request_id field in the response for the Verify check.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.Psd2Request.Payee
member.summary: An alphanumeric string to indicate to the user the name of the recipient that they are confirming a payment to.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.Psd2Request.Amount
member.summary: The Decimal amount of the payment to be confirmed, in Euros

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.Psd2Request.WorkflowId
member.summary: Selects the predefined sequence of SMS and TTS (Text To Speech) actions to use in order to convey the PIN to your user. For example, an id of 1 identifies the workflow SMS - TTS - TTS. For a list of all workflows and their associated ids, please visit the developer portal.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyCheck.DateReceived
member.summary: The date and time this check was received (in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS)

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyCheck.Code
member.summary: The code supplied with this check request

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyCheck.Status
member.summary: One of: VALID or INVALID

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyCheck.IpAddress
member.summary: The IP address, if available (this field is no longer used).

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyCheckRequest.RequestId
member.summary: The Verify request to check. This is the request_id you received in the response to the Verify request

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyCheckRequest.Code
member.summary: The verification code entered by your user.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyCheckRequest.IpAddress
member.summary: (This field is no longer used)

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyCheckResponse.RequestId
member.summary: The request_id that you received in the response to the Verify request and used in the Verify check request.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyCheckResponse.EventId
member.summary: The ID of the verification event, such as an SMS or TTS call.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyCheckResponse.Price
member.summary: The cost incurred for this request.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyCheckResponse.Currency
member.summary: The currency code.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyCheckResponse.EstimatedPriceMessagesSent
member.summary: This field may not be present, depending on your pricing model. The value indicates the cost (in EUR) of the calls made and messages sent for the verification process. This value may be updated during and shortly after the request completes because user input events can overlap with message/call events. When this field is present, the total cost of the verification is the sum of this field and the price field.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyControlRequest.RequestId
member.summary: The request_id you received in the response to the Verify request.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyControlRequest.Cmd
member.summary: The possible commands are cancel to request cancellation of the verification process, or trigger_next_event to advance to the next verification event (if any). Cancellation is only possible 30 seconds after the start of the verification request and before the second event (either TTS or SMS) has taken place. must be one of 'cancel' or 'trigger_next_event'

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyRequest.Brand
member.summary: An 18-character alphanumeric string you can use to personalize the verification request SMS body, to help users identify your company or application name. For example: "Your Acme Inc PIN is ..."

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyRequest.SenderId
member.summary: An 11-character alphanumeric string that represents the identity of the sender of the verification request: https://developer.nexmo.com/messaging/sms/guides/custom-sender-id. Depending on the destination of the phone number you are sending the verification SMS to, restrictions might apply.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyRequest.WorkflowId
member.summary: Selects the predefined sequence of SMS and TTS (Text To Speech) actions to use in order to convey the PIN to your user. For example, an id of 1 identifies the workflow SMS - TTS - TTS. For a list of all workflows and their associated ids, please visit the developer portal.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyRequestBase.Number
member.summary: The mobile or landline phone number to verify. Unless you are setting country explicitly, this number must be in E.164 format.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyRequestBase.Country
member.summary: If you do not provide number in international format or you are not sure if number is correctly formatted, specify the two-character country code in country. Verify will then format the number for you.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyRequestBase.CodeLength
member.summary: The length of the verification code. Must be 4 or 6

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyRequestBase.Lg
member.summary: By default, the SMS or text-to-speech (TTS) message is generated in the locale that matches the number. For example, the text message or TTS message for a 33* number is sent in French. Use this parameter to explicitly control the language used for the Verify request. A list of languages is available: https://developer.nexmo.com/verify/guides/verify-languages

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyRequestBase.PinExpiry
member.summary: How long the generated verification code is valid for, in seconds. When you specify both pin_expiry and next_event_wait then pin_expiry must be an integer multiple of next_event_wait otherwise pin_expiry is defaulted to equal next_event_wait. See changing the event timings: https://developer.nexmo.com/verify/guides/changing-default-timings.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyRequestBase.NextEventWait
member.summary: Specifies the wait time in seconds between attempts to deliver the verification code. Must be between 60 and 900

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyResponse.RequestId
member.summary: The unique ID of the Verify request. This may be blank in an error situation.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyResponse.Network
member.summary: The Network ID of the blocking network, if relevant to the error.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyResponseBase.ErrorText
member.summary: If the status is non-zero, this explains the error encountered.

member.name: P:Vonage.Verify.VerifyResponseBase.Status
member.summary: A value of 0 indicates that your user entered the correct code. If it is non-zero, check the error_text.

member.summary: The request_id you received in the Verify Request Response.

member.summary: Whether the archive will record audio (true, the default) or not (false). If you set both hasAudio and hasVideo to false, the call to this method results in an error.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Archives.Archive.HasVideo
member.summary: Whether the archive will record video (true, the default) or not (false). If you set both hasAudio and hasVideo to false, the call to this method results in an error.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Archives.Archive.Id
member.summary: The unique archive ID.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Archives.Archive.Name
member.summary: The name of the archive (for your own identification).

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Archives.Archive.Reason
member.summary: For archives with the status "stopped", this can be set to "maximum duration exceeded", "maximum idle time exceeded", "session ended", "user initiated". For archives with the status "failed", this can be set to "failure".

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Archives.Archive.Resolution
member.summary: The resolution of the archive, either "640x480" (SD landscape, the default), "1280x720" (HD landscape), "1920x1080" (FHD landscape), "480x640" (SD portrait), "720x1280" (HD portrait), or "1080x1920" (FHD portrait). You may want to use a portrait aspect ratio for archives that include video streams from mobile devices (which often use the portrait aspect ratio). This property only applies to composed archives. If you set this property and set the outputMode property to "individual", the call to the REST method results in an error.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Archives.Archive.SessionId
member.summary: The session ID of the Vonage Video session you are working with.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Archives.Archive.Size
member.summary: The size of the archive file. For archives that have not been generated, this value is set to 0.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Archives.Archive.Status
member.summary: The status of the archive: "available" The archive is available for download from the Vonage Video cloud. "expired" The archive is no longer available for download from the Vonage Video cloud. "failed" The archive recording failed. "paused" When an archive is paused, nothing is recorded. The archive is paused if any of the following conditions occur: No clients are publishing streams to the session. In this case, there is a timeout of 60 minutes, after which the archive stops and the archive status changes to "stopped". All clients disconnect the session. After 60 seconds the archive stops and the archive status changes to "stopped". If a client resumes publishing while the archive is in the "paused" state, the archive recording resumes and the status changes back to "started". "started" The archive started and is in the process of being recorded. "stopped" The archive stopped recording. "uploaded" The archive is available for download from the S3 bucket you specified in your Video API account.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Archives.Archive.StreamMode
member.summary: Whether streams included in the archive are selected automatically ("auto", the default) or manually ("manual"). When streams are selected automatically ("auto"), all streams in the session can be included in the archive. When streams are selected manually ("manual"), you specify streams to be included based on calls to this REST method. You can specify whether a stream's audio, video, or both are included in the archive. In composed archives, in both automatic and manual modes, the archive composer includes streams based on stream prioritization rules.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Archives.Archive.Streams
member.summary: The collection of streams.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Archives.Archive.Url
P:Vonage.Video.Archives.Archive.MultiArchiveTag
member.summary: Set this to support recording multiple archives for the same session simultaneously. Set this to a unique string for each simultaneous archive of an ongoing session. You must also set this option when manually starting an archive in a session that is automatically archived. If you do not specify a unique multiArchiveTag, you can only record one archive at a time for a given session.
Creates an archive.
member.param: The timestamp for when the archive started recording, expressed in milliseconds since the Unix epoch (January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC).
The duration of the archive in seconds. For archives that have are being recorded (with the status property set to "started"), this value is set to 0.
Whether the archive will record audio (true, the default) or not (false). If you set both hasAudio and hasVideo to false, the call to this method results in an error.
Whether the archive will record video (true, the default) or not (false). If you set both hasAudio and hasVideo to false, the call to this method results in an error.
The name of the archive (for your own identification)

For archives with the status "stopped", this can be set to "maximum duration exceeded", "maximum idle time exceeded", "session ended", "user initiated". For archives with the status "failed", this can be set to "failure".

The resolution of the archive, either "640x480" (SD landscape, the default), "1280x720" (HD landscape), "1920x1080" (FHD landscape), "480x640" (SD portrait), "720x1280" (HD portrait), or "1080x1920" (FHD portrait). You may want to use a portrait aspect ratio for archives that include video streams from mobile devices (which often use the portrait aspect ratio). This property only applies to composed archives. If you set this property and set the outputMode property to "individual", the call to the REST method results in an error.
The session ID of the Vonage Video session you are working with
The size of the archive file. For archives that have not been generated, this value is set to 0.

Whether streams included in the archive are selected automatically ("auto", the default) or manually ("manual"). When streams are selected automatically ("auto"), all streams in the session can be included in the archive. When streams are selected manually ("manual"), you specify streams to be included based on calls to this REST method. You can specify whether a stream's audio, video, or both are included in the archive. In composed archives, in both automatic and manual modes, the archive composer includes streams based on stream prioritization rules.

The download URL of the available archive file. This is only set for an archive with the status set to "available"; for other archives, (including archives with the status "uploaded") this property is set to null. The download URL is obfuscated, and the file is only available from the URL for 10 minutes.

Set this to support recording multiple archives for the same session simultaneously. Set this to a unique string for each simultaneous archive of an ongoing session. You must also set this option when manually starting an archive in a session that is automatically archived. If you do not specify a unique multiArchiveTag, you can only record one archive at a time for a given session.

member.summary: Defines values for the role parameter of the GenerateToken method of the OpenTok class.

member.name: F:Vonage.Video.Authentication.Role.Publisher
member.summary: A publisher can publish streams, subscribe to streams, and signal. (This is the default value if you do not set a role when calling GenerateToken method of the OpenTok class.

member.name: F:Vonage.Video.Authentication.Role.Subscriber
member.summary: A subscriber can only subscribe to streams.

member.name: F:Vonage.Video.Authentication.Role.Moderator
member.summary: In addition to the privileges granted to a publisher, a moderator can perform moderation functions, such as forcing clients to disconnect, to stop publishing streams, or to mute audio in published streams. See the Moderation developer guide.

member.name: F:Vonage.Video.Authentication.Role.PublisherOnly
member.summary: A publisher-only role can publish streams, but not signal.

member.name: T:Vonage.Video.Authentication.TokenAdditionalClaims
member.summary: Represents additional claims for the Video Client's token.

member.name: F:Vonage.Video.Authentication.TokenAdditionalClaims.DefaultScope
member.summary: Represents the default scope (session.connect).

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Authentication.TokenAdditionalClaims.Role
member.summary: This defines the role the user will have. There are three roles: subscriber, publisher, and moderator. Subscribers can only subscribe to streams in the session (they cannot publish). Publishers can subscribe and publish streams to the session, and they can use the signaling API. Moderators have the privileges of publishers and, in addition, they can also force other users to disconnect from the session or to cease publishing. The default role (if no value is passed) is publisher.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Authentication.TokenAdditionalClaims.Scope
member.summary: The session's scope.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Authentication.TokenAdditionalClaims.Claims
member.summary: The custom claims.

member.summary: Creates claims.
member.param: The session ID corresponding to the session to which the user will connect.

This defines the role the user will have. There are three roles: subscriber, publisher, and moderator. Subscribers can only subscribe to streams in the session (they cannot publish). Publishers can subscribe and publish streams to the session, and they can use the signaling API. Moderators have the privileges of publishers and, in addition, they can also force other users to disconnect from the session or to cease publishing. The default role (if no value is passed) is publisher.
member.returns: A success state with claims if the parsing succeeded. A failure state with an error if it failed.

member.name: F:Vonage.Video.Broadcast.Broadcast.BroadcastStatus.Started

member.name: T:Vonage.Video.Broadcast.Broadcast.BroadcastUrl
member.summary: Represents information regarding HLS and RTMP broadcasts.
member.param: If you specified an HLS endpoint, the object includes an hls property, which is set to the URL for the HLS broadcast. Note this HLS broadcast URL points to an index file, an .M3U8- formatted playlist that contains a list of URLs to .ts media segment files (MPEG-2 transport stream files). While the URLs of both the playlist index file and media segment files are provided as soon as the HTTP response is returned, these URLs should not be accessed until 15 20 seconds later, after the initiation of the HLS broadcast, due to the delay between the HLS broadcast and the live streams in the OpenTok session. See https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/technotes/tn2288/_index.html for more information about the playlist index file and media segment files for HLS.

If you specified RTMP stream endpoints, the object includes an rtmp property. This is an array of objects that include information on each of the RTMP streams. Each of these objects has the following properties: id (the ID you assigned to the RTMP stream),serverUrl (the server URL), streamName (the stream name), and status property (which is set to "connecting"). You can call the OpenTok REST method to check for status updates for the broadcast.

member.summary: The status of the RTMP stream. Poll frequently to check status updates.

member.name: F:Vonage.Video.Broadcast.Broadcast.RtmpStatus.Connecting
member.summary: Indicates the platform is in the process of connecting to the remote RTMP server. This is the initial state, and it is the status if you start when there are no streams published in the session. It changes to "live" when there are streams (or it changes to one of the other states).

member.name: F:Vonage.Video.Broadcast.Broadcast.RtmpStatus.Live
member.summary: Indicates platform has successfully connected to the remote RTMP server, and the media is streaming.

member.name: F:Vonage.Video.Broadcast.Broadcast.RtmpStatus.Offline
member.summary: Indicates platform could not connect to the remote RTMP server. This is due to an unreachable server or an error in the RTMP handshake. Causes include rejected RTMP connections, non-existing RTMP applications, rejected stream names, authentication errors, etc. Check that the server is online, and that you have provided the correct server URL and stream name.

member.name: F:Vonage.Video.Broadcast.Broadcast.RtmpStatus.Error
member.summary: Indicates there is an error in the platform.

member.summary: The count query parameter to limit the number of archives to be returned. The default number of archives returned is 50 (or fewer, if there are fewer than 50 archives). The maximum number of archives the call will return is 1000.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Broadcast.GetBroadcasts.GetBroadcastsRequest.Offset
member.summary: The offset query parameters to specify the index offset of the first archive. 0 is offset of the most recently started archive (excluding deleted archive). 1 is the offset of the archive that started prior to the most recent archive. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Broadcast.GetBroadcasts.GetBroadcastsRequest.SessionId
member.summary: The sessionId query parameter to list archives for a specific session ID. (This is useful when listing multiple archives for an automatically archived session.)

member.summary: Vonage Application UUID.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Broadcast.StartBroadcast.StartBroadcastRequest.Layout
member.summary: Specify this to assign the initial layout type for the broadcast. If you do not specify an initial layout type, the broadcast stream uses the Best Fit layout type. For more information, see Configuring Video Layout for the OpenTok live streaming feature.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Broadcast.StartBroadcast.StartBroadcastRequest.MaxDuration
member.summary: The maximum duration for the broadcast, in seconds. The broadcast will automatically stop when the maximum duration is reached. You can set the maximum duration to a value from 60 (60 seconds) to 36000 (10 hours). The default maximum duration is 4 hours (14,400 seconds)

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Broadcast.StartBroadcast.StartBroadcastRequest.MultiBroadcastTag
member.summary: Set this to support multiple broadcasts for the same session simultaneously. Set this to a unique string for each simultaneous broadcast of an ongoing session. See Simultaneous broadcasts.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Broadcast.StartBroadcast.StartBroadcastRequest.Outputs
member.summary: This object defines the types of broadcast streams you want to start (both HLS and RTMP). You can include HLS, RTMP, or both as broadcast streams. If you include RTMP streaming, you can specify up to five target RTMP streams (or just one). Vonage streams the session to each RTMP URL you specify. Note that OpenTok live streaming supports RTMP and RTMPS.

member.name: T:Vonage.Video.Moderation.MuteStreams.MuteStreamsRequest
member.summary: Represents a request to mute streams.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Moderation.MuteStreams.MuteStreamsRequest.Configuration
member.summary: The request content.

member.name: M:Vonage.Video.Moderation.MuteStreams.MuteStreamsRequest.Build
member.summary: Initializes a builder.

member.name: T:Vonage.Video.Moderation.MuteStreams.MuteStreamsRequest.MuteStreamsConfiguration
member.summary: Represents a configuration for muting streams.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Moderation.MuteStreams.MuteStreamsRequest.MuteStreamsConfiguration.Active
member.summary: Whether to mute streams in the session (true) and enable the mute state of the session, or to disable the mute state of the session (false). With the mute state enabled (true), all current and future streams published to the session (with the exception of streams in the excludedStreamIds array) are muted. When you call this method with the active property set to false, future streams published to the session are not muted (but any existing muted streams remain muted).

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Moderation.MuteStreams.MuteStreamsRequest.MuteStreamsConfiguration.ExcludedStreamIds
member.summary: The stream IDs for streams that should not be muted. This is an optional property. If you omit this property, all streams in the session will be muted. This property only applies when the active property is set to true. When the active property is set to false, it is ignored. The elements in the excludedStreamIds array are stream IDs (strings) for the streams you wish to exclude from being muted. If you do not wish to include an array of excluded streams, do not include any body content.

member.name: M:Vonage.Video.Moderation.MuteStreams.MuteStreamsRequest.MuteStreamsConfiguration.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Creates a configuration.
member.param: Whether to mute streams in the session (true) and enable the mute state of the session, or to disable the mute state of the session (false). With the mute state enabled (true), all current and future streams published to the session (with the exception of streams in the excludedStreamIds array) are muted. When you call this method with the active property set to false, future streams published to the session are not muted (but any existing muted streams remain muted).

The stream IDs for streams that should not be muted. This is an optional property. If you omit this property, all streams in the session will be muted. This property only applies when the active property is set to true. When the active property is set to false, it is ignored. The elements in the excludedStreamIds array are stream IDs (strings) for the streams you wish to exclude from being muted. If you do not wish to include an array of excluded streams, do not include any body content.

member.name: T:Vonage.Video.Sessions.CreateSession.CreateSessionRequest
member.summary: Represents a request for creating a session.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Sessions.CreateSession.CreateSessionRequest.ArchiveMode
member.summary: Set to always to have the session archived automatically. With the archiveMode set to manual (the default), you can archive the session by calling the REST /archive POST method. If you set the archiveMode to always, you must also set the p2p.preference parameter to disabled (the default).

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Sessions.CreateSession.CreateSessionRequest.Default
member.summary: Creates a default request with empty ip address, relayed media mode and manual archive mode.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Sessions.CreateSession.CreateSessionRequest.Location
member.summary: The IP address that the Vonage Video APi will use to situate the session in its global network. If no location hint is passed in (which is recommended), the session uses a media server based on the location of the first client connecting to the session. Pass a location hint in only if you know the general geographic region (and a representative IP address) and you think the first client connecting may not be in that region. Specify an IP address that is representative of the geographical location for the session.

member.summary: The session will attempt to transmit streams directly between clients. If two clients cannot send and receive each others' streams, due to firewalls on the clients' networks, their streams will be relayed using the OpenTok TURN Server.

member.name: T:Vonage.Video.Sip.InitiateCall.SipElement
member.summary: Represents a SIP element.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Sip.InitiateCall.SipElement.Authentication
member.summary: Contains the username and password to be used in the the SIP INVITE request for HTTP digest authentication, if it is required by your SIP platform.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Sip.InitiateCall.SipElement.From
member.summary: The number or string that will be sent to the final SIP number as the caller. It must be a string in the form of from@example.com, where from can be a string or a number. If from is set to a number (for example, "14155550101@example.com"), it will show up as the incoming number on PSTN phones. If from is undefined or set to a string (for example, "joe@example.com"), +00000000 will show up as the incoming number on PSTN phones.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Sip.InitiateCall.SipElement.HasEncryptedMedia
member.summary: Indicates whether the media must be transmitted encrypted. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Sip.InitiateCall.SipElement.HasForceMute
member.summary: Indicates whether the SIP end point observes force mute moderation. Also, with observeForceMute set to true, the caller can press"*6" to unmute and mute the published audio. For the "*6" mute toggle to work, the SIP caller must negotiate RFC2833 DTMFs (RFC2833/RFC4733 digits). The mute toggle is not supported with SIP INFO or in-band DTMFs. A message (in English) is played to the caller when the caller mutes and unmutes, or when the SIP client is muted through a force mute action. The default is false.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Sip.InitiateCall.SipElement.HasVideo
member.summary: Indicates whether the SIP call will include video. With video included, the SIP client's video is included in the OpenTok stream that is sent to the OpenTok session. The SIP client will receive a single composed video of the published streams in the OpenTok session. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Sip.InitiateCall.SipElement.Headers
member.summary: Defines custom headers to be added to the SIP INVITE request initiated fromOpenTok to your SIP platform.

member.name: P:Vonage.Video.Sip.InitiateCall.SipElement.Uri
member.summary: The SIP URI to be used as destination of the SIP call initiated from OpenTok to your SIP platform. If the SIP uri contains a transport=tls header, the negotiation between Vonage and the SIP endpoint will be done securely. Note that this will only apply to the negotiation itself,and not to the transmission of audio. If you also audio transmission to be encrypted, set the secure property to true.

member.name: T:Vonage.Server.Layout
member.summary: Represents a layout.
member.param: Set the screenshareType property to the layout type to use when there is a screen-sharing stream in the session. (This property is optional.) Note if you set the screenshareType property, you must set the type property to "bestFit" and leave the stylesheet property unset.
Used for the custom layout to define the visual layout.

Specify this to assign the initial layout type for the archive. This applies only to composed archives. Valid values for the layout property are "bestFit" (best fit), "custom" (custom), "horizontalPresentation" (horizontal presentation), "pip" (picture-in-picture), and "verticalPresentation" (vertical presentation)). If you specify a "custom" layout type, set the stylesheet property of the layout object to the stylesheet. (For other layout types, do not set a stylesheet property.).

member.name: M:Vonage.Server.Layout.#ctor(System.Nullable{Vonage.Server.LayoutType},System.String,Vonage.Server.LayoutType)
member.summary: Represents a layout.
member.param: Set the screenshareType property to the layout type to use when there is a screen-sharing stream in the session. (This property is optional.) Note if you set the screenshareType property, you must set the type property to "bestFit" and leave the stylesheet property unset.
Used for the custom layout to define the visual layout.

Specify this to assign the initial layout type for the archive. This applies only to composed archives. Valid values for the layout property are "bestFit" (best fit), "custom" (custom), "horizontalPresentation" (horizontal presentation), "pip" (picture-in-picture), and "verticalPresentation" (vertical presentation)). If you specify a "custom" layout type, set the stylesheet property of the layout object to the stylesheet. (For other layout types, do not set a stylesheet property.).

member.name: P:Vonage.Server.Layout.ScreenshareType
member.summary: Set the screenshareType property to the layout type to use when there is a screen-sharing stream in the session. (This property is optional.) Note if you set the screenshareType property, you must set the type property to "bestFit" and leave the stylesheet property unset.

member.name: P:Vonage.Server.Layout.Stylesheet
member.summary: Used for the custom layout to define the visual layout.

member.name: P:Vonage.Server.Layout.Type
member.summary: Specify this to assign the initial layout type for the archive. This applies only to composed archives. Valid values for the layout property are "bestFit" (best fit), "custom" (custom), "horizontalPresentation" (horizontal presentation), "pip" (picture-in-picture), and "verticalPresentation" (vertical presentation)). If you specify a "custom" layout type, set the stylesheet property of the layout object to the stylesheet. (For other layout types, do not set a stylesheet property.).

member.name: T:Vonage.Voice.AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties
member.summary: Represents the properties for Advanced Machine Detection.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties.BeepTimeout
member.summary: Maximum time in seconds Vonage should wait for a machine beep to be detected. A machine event with sub_state set to beep_timeout will be sent if the timeout is exceeded.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties.Behavior
member.summary: When hangup is used, the call will be terminated if a machine is detected. When continue is used, the call will continue even if a machine is detected.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties.Mode
member.summary: Detect if machine answered and sends a human or machine status in the webhook payload. When set to detect_beep, the system also attempts to detect voice mail beep and sends an additional parameter sub_state in the webhook with the value beep_start.

member.name: M:Vonage.Voice.AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties.#ctor(Vonage.Voice.AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties.MachineDetectionBehavior,Vonage.Voice.AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties.MachineDetectionMode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor for AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties.
member.param: When hangup is used, the call will be terminated if a machine is detected. When continue is used, the call will continue even if a machine is detected.

Detect if machine answered and sends a human or machine status in the webhook payload. When set to detect_beep, the system also attempts to detect voice mail beep and sends an additional parameter sub_state in the webhook with the value beep_start.
Maximum time in seconds Vonage should wait for a machine beep to be detected. A machine event with sub_state set to beep_timeout will be sent if the timeout is exceeded.
member.exception: When Beep Timeout is lower than 45, or higher than 120.

member.name: T:Vonage.Voice.AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties.MachineDetectionBehavior
member.summary: Represents the behavior for AdvancedMachineDetection.

member.name: F:Vonage.Voice.AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties.MachineDetectionBehavior.Continue
member.summary: Indicates the call will continue even if a machine is detected.

member.name: F:Vonage.Voice.AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties.MachineDetectionBehavior.Hangup
member.summary: Indicates the call will be terminated if a machine is detected.

member.name: T:Vonage.Voice.AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties.MachineDetectionMode
member.summary: Represents the mode for AdvancedMachineDetection.

member.name: F:Vonage.Voice.AdvancedMachineDetectionProperties.MachineDetectionMode.Detect
member.summary: Indicates the system detects if a machine answered and send a status in the webhook payload.

member.summary: Indicates the system also attempts to detect voice mail beep and sends an additional parameter sub_state in the webhook with the value beep_start.

member.name: T:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand
member.summary: Represents a command to start a call.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand.AdvancedMachineDetection
member.summary: Configure the behavior of Vonage's advanced machine detection. Overrides machineDetection if both are set.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand.AnswerMethod
member.summary: Optional. The HTTP method used to send event information to answer_url. The default value is GET.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand.AnswerUrl
member.summary: The webhook endpoint where you provide the Vonage Call Control Object that governs this call. As soon as your user answers a call, Platform requests this NCCO from answer_url. Use answer_method to manage the HTTP method.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand.EventMethod
member.summary: Optional. The HTTP method used to send event information to event_url. The default value is POST.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand.EventUrl
member.summary: Optional. Platform sends event information asynchronously to this endpoint when status changes. For more information about the values sent, see callback.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand.From
member.summary: The endpoint you are calling from. Possible value are the same as to.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand.LengthTimer
member.summary: Optional. Set the number of seconds that elapse before Vonage hangs up after the call state changes to in_progress. The default value is 7200, two hours. This is also the maximum value.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand.MachineDetection
member.summary: Optional. Configure the behavior when Vonage detects that a destination is an answerphone.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand.Ncco
member.summary: This will convert to ncco as per the CallCommandConverter - it is preferable to use this over the JArray Ncco

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand.RandomFromNumber
member.summary: Set to true to use random phone number as the from. This number will be selected from the list of nubmers assigned to the current application. RandomFromNumber = true cannot be used together with From

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand.RingingTimer
member.summary: Optional. Set the number of seconds that elapse before Vonage hangs up after the call state changes to 'ringing'. The default value is 60, the maximum value is 120.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallCommand.To

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallEditCommand.Action
member.summary: Use one of the following options to modify the call: hangup Terminates this call leg. mute Mutes this call leg. unmute Unmutes this call leg. earmuff Prevents the recipient of this call leg from hearing other parts of the conversation. unearmuff Removes the earmuff effect from this call leg. transfer Transfers this call leg to another NCCO, as specified by the destination parameter.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.CallEditCommand.Destination

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.AdvancedMachineDetection
member.summary: Configure the behavior of Vonage's advanced machine detection. Overrides machineDetection if both are set.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.Endpoint
member.summary: Connect to a single endpoint.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.EventMethod
member.summary: The HTTP method Vonage uses to make the request to eventUrl. The default value is POST.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.EventType
member.summary: Set to synchronous to: make the connect action synchronous enable eventUrl to return an NCCO that overrides the current NCCO when a call moves to specific states.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.EventUrl
member.summary: Set the webhook endpoint that Vonage calls asynchronously on each of the possible Call States. If eventType is set to synchronous the eventUrl can return an NCCO that overrides the current NCCO when a timeout occurs.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.From
member.summary: A number in E.164 format that identifies the caller. This must be one of your Vonage virtual numbers, another value will result in the caller ID being unknown. If the caller is an app user, this option should be omitted.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.Limit
member.summary: Maximum length of the call in seconds. The default and maximum value is 7200 seconds (2 hours).

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.MachineDetection
member.summary: Configure the behavior when Vonage detects that a destination is an answerphone. Set to either: continue - Vonage sends an HTTP request to event_url with the Call event machine hangup - end the Call

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.RingbackTone
member.summary: A URL value that points to a ringbackTone to be played back on repeat to the caller, so they don't hear silence. The ringbackTone will automatically stop playing when the call is fully connected. It's not recommended to use this parameter when connecting to a phone endpoint, as the carrier will supply their own ringbackTone. Example: "ringbackTone": "http://example.com/ringbackTone.wav".

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConnectAction.Timeout
member.summary: If the call is unanswered, set the number in seconds before Vonage stops ringing endpoint. The default value is 60.

member.name: T:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction
member.summary: Represents a NCCO Conversation.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.Action
member.summary: Returns the Conversation ActionType.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.CanHear
member.summary: A list of leg UUIDs that this participant can hear. If not provided, the participant can hear everyone. If an empty list is provided, the participant will not hear any other participants

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.CanSpeak
member.summary: A list of leg UUIDs that this participant can be heard by. If not provided, the participant can be heard by everyone. If an empty list is provided, the participant will not be heard by anyone

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.EndOnExit
member.summary: Specifies whether a moderated conversation ends when the moderator hangs up. This is set to false by default, which means that the conversation only ends when the last remaining participant hangs up, regardless of whether the moderator is still on the call. Set endOnExit to true to terminate the conversation when the moderator hangs up.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.MusicOnHoldUrl
member.summary: A URL to the mp3 file to stream to participants until the conversation starts. By default the conversation starts when the first person calls the virtual number associated with your Voice app. To stream this mp3 before the moderator joins the conversation, set startOnEnter to false for all users other than the moderator.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.Name
member.summary: The name of the Conversation room. Names are namespaced to the application level.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.Record
member.summary: Set to true to record this conversation. For standard conversations, recordings start when one or more attendees connects to the conversation. For moderated conversations, recordings start when the moderator joins. That is, when an NCCO is executed for the named conversation where startOnEnter is set to true. When the recording is terminated, the URL you download the recording from is sent to the event URL. By default audio is recorded in MP3 format. See the recording guide for more details

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.ConversationAction.StartOnEnter
member.summary: The default value of true ensures that the conversation starts when this caller joins conversation name. Set to false for attendees in a moderated conversation.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.AppEndpoint.User
member.summary: the username of the user to connect to. This username must have been added as a user

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.Endpoint.Type
member.summary: the type of endpoint being connected

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.PhoneEndpoint.Number
member.summary: The phone number to connect to in E.164 format.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.PhoneEndpoint.DtmfAnswer
member.summary: Set the digits that are sent to the user as soon as the Call is answered. The * and # digits are respected. You create pauses using p. Each pause is 500ms.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.PhoneEndpoint.OnAnswer
member.summary: An object containing a required url key. The URL serves an NCCO to execute in the number being connected to, before that call is joined to your existing conversation. Optionally, the ringbackTone key can be specified with a URL value that points to a ringbackTone to be played back on repeat to the caller, so they do not hear just silence. The ringbackTone will automatically stop playing when the call is fully connected. Example: {"url":"https://example.com/answer", "ringbackTone":"http://example.com/ringbackTone.wav" }. Please note, the key ringback is still supported.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.SipEndpoint.Uri
member.summary: the SIP URI to the endpoint you are connecting to in the format sip:rebekka@sip.example.com.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.SipEndpoint.Headers
member.summary: key => value string pairs containing any metadata you need e.g. { "location": "New York City", "occupation": "developer" }

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.VbcEndpoint.Extension
member.summary: the VBC extension to connect the call to.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.WebsocketEndpoint.ContentType
member.summary: the internet media type for the audio you are streaming. Possible values are: audio/l16;rate=16000 or audio/l16;rate=8000.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.WebsocketEndpoint.Headers
member.summary: an object containing any metadata you want. See connecting to a websocket for example headers

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.Endpoints.WebsocketEndpoint.Uri
member.summary: the URI to the websocket you are streaming to.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.MultiInputAction.EventUrl
member.summary: Vonage sends the digits pressed by the callee to this URL 1) after timeOut pause in activity or when # is pressed for DTMF or 2) after user stops speaking or 30 seconds of speech for speech input.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.MultiInputAction.EventMethod
member.summary: The HTTP method used to send event information to event_url The default value is POST.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.MultiInputAction.Dtmf
member.summary: DTMF settings. Should be specified to enable DTMF input. If all the DTMF input settings will have default values, it should be specified as empty object NOTE: this is serialized as an empty object if not initalized by the user

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.MultiInputAction.Type
member.summary: Acceptable input type. Can be set as [ "dtmf" ] for DTMF input only, [ "speech" ] for ASR only, or [ "dtmf", "speech" ] for both. Is required.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.MultiInputAction.Speech
member.summary: Speech recognition settings. Should be specified to enable speech input.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.NotifyAction.Payload
member.summary: The JSON object body to send to your event URL

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.NotifyAction.EventUrl
member.summary: The URL to send events to. If you return an NCCO when you receive a notification, it will replace the current NCCO

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.NotifyAction.EventMethod
member.summary: The HTTP method to use when sending payload to your eventUrl

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.BeepStart
member.summary: Set to true to play a beep when a recording starts

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.Channels
member.summary: The number of channels to record (maximum 32). If the number of participants exceeds channels any additional participants will be added to the last channel in file. split conversation must also be enabled

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.EndOnKey
member.summary: Stop recording when a digit is pressed on the handset. Possible values are: *, # or any single digit e.g. 9

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.EndOnSilence
member.summary: Stop recording after n seconds of silence. Once the recording is stopped the recording data is sent to event_url. The range of possible values is 3<=endOnSilence<=10.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.EventMethod
member.summary: The HTTP method used to make the request to eventUrl. The default value is POST.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.EventUrl
member.summary: The URL to the webhook endpoint that is called asynchronously when a recording is finished. If the message recording is hosted by Vonage, this webhook contains the URL you need to download the recording and other meta data.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.Format
member.summary: Record the Call in a specific format. The default value is mp3, or wav when recording more than 2 channels.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.Split
member.summary: Record the sent and received audio in separate channels of a stereo recordingset to conversation to enable this.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.RecordAction.TimeOut
member.summary: The maximum length of a recording in seconds. One the recording is stopped the recording data is sent to event_url. The range of possible values is between 3 seconds and 7200 seconds (2 hours)

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.SpeechSettings.Uuid
member.summary: The unique ID of the Call leg for the user to capture the speech of.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.SpeechSettings.EndOnSilence
member.summary: Controls how long the system will wait after user stops speaking to decide the input is completed. The default value is 2 (seconds). The range of possible values is between 1 second and 10 seconds.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.SpeechSettings.Language
member.summary: Expected language of the user's speech. Format: BCP-47. Default: en-US see list of supported languages: https://developer.nexmo.com/voice/voice-api/guides/asr#language

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.SpeechSettings.Context
member.summary: Array of hints (strings) to improve recognition quality if certain words are expected from the user.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.SpeechSettings.StartTimeout
member.summary: Controls how long the system will wait for the user to start speaking. The range of possible values is between 1 second and 10 seconds.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.SpeechSettings.MaxDuration
member.summary: Controls maximum speech duration (from the moment user starts speaking). The default value is 60 (seconds). The range of possible values is between 1 and 60 seconds.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.StreamAction.BargeIn
member.summary: Set to true so this action is terminated when the user presses a button on the keypad. Use this feature to enable users to choose an option without having to listen to the whole message in your Interactive Voice Response (IVR ). If you set bargeIn to true on one more Stream actions then the next non-stream action in the NCCO stack must be an input action. The default value is false. Once bargeIn is set to true it will stay true (even if bargeIn: false is set in a following action) until an input action is encountered

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.StreamAction.Level
member.summary: Set the audio level of the stream in the range -1 >=level<=1 with a precision of 0.1. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.StreamAction.Loop
member.summary: The number of times audio is repeated before the Call is closed. The default value is 1. Set to 0 to loop infinitely.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.StreamAction.StreamUrl
member.summary: An array containing a single URL to an mp3 or wav (16-bit) audio file to stream to the Call or Conversation.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.TalkAction.BargeIn
member.summary: Set to true so this action is terminated when the user presses a button on the keypad. Use this feature to enable users to choose an option without having to listen to the whole message in your Interactive Voice Response (IVR ). If you set bargeIn to true on one more Stream actions then the next non-stream action in the NCCO stack must be an input action. The default value is false. Once bargeIn is set to true it will stay true (even if bargeIn: false is set in a following action) until an input action is encountered

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.TalkAction.Language
member.summary: The language (BCP-47format) for the message you are sending. Default: en-US. Possible values are listed in the Text-To-Speech guide.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.TalkAction.Level
member.summary: The volume level that the speech is played. This can be any value between -1 to 1 with 0 being the default.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.TalkAction.Loop
member.summary: The number of times text is repeated before the Call is closed. The default value is 1. Set to 0 to loop infinitely.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.TalkAction.Premium
member.summary: Set to true to use the premium version of the specified style if available, otherwise the standard version will be used. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.TalkAction.Style
member.summary: The vocal style (vocal range, tessitura and timbre). Default: 0. Possible values are listed in the Text-To-Speech guide.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.Nccos.TalkAction.Text
member.summary: A string of up to 1,500 characters (excluding SSML tags) containing the message to be synthesized in the Call or Conversation. A single comma in text adds a short pause to the synthesized speech. To add a longer pause a break tag needs to be used in SSML. To use SSML tags, you must enclose the text in a speak element.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.StreamCommand.StreamUrl
member.summary: An array of URLs pointing to the .mp3 or .wav audio file to stream.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.StreamCommand.Loop
member.summary: Set to 0 to replay the audio file at stream_url when the stream ends.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.StreamCommand.Level
member.summary: Set the audio level of the stream in the range -1 >= level <= 1 with a precision of 0.1. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.TalkCommand.Text
member.summary: A UTF-8 and URL encoded string of up to 1500 characters containing the message to be synthesized in the Call or Conversation. Each comma in text adds a short pause to the synthesized speech.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.TalkCommand.Loop
member.summary: Set to 0 to replay the audio file at stream_url when the stream ends. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.TalkCommand.Level
member.summary: The volume level that the speech is played. This can be any value between -1 to 1 in 0.1 increments, with 0 being the default.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.TalkCommand.Language
member.summary: The language (BCP-47format) for the message you are sending. Default: en-US. Possible values are listed in the Text-To-Speech guide.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.TalkCommand.Style
member.summary: The vocal style (vocal range, tessitura and timbre). Default: 0. Possible values are listed in the Text-To-Speech guide.

member.name: P:Vonage.Voice.TalkCommand.Premium
member.summary: Set to `true` to use the premium version of the specified style if available, otherwise the standard version will be used. You can find more information about Premium Voices in the [Text-To-Speech guide](https://developer.vonage.com/en/voice/voice-api/guides/text-to-speech#premium-voices).

member.summary: Gets the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.

The diagnostic ID is shown in build output for warnings and errors.
This property represents the unique ID that can be used to suppress the warnings or errors, if needed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.UrlFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL for corresponding documentation. The API accepts a format string instead of an actual URL, creating a generic URL that includes the diagnostic ID.

member.remarks: An example format string is https://contoso.com/obsoletion-warnings/{0}.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnscopedRefAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate a byref escapes and is not scoped.

remarks.para: There are several cases where the C# compiler treats a as implicitly - where the compiler does not allow the to escape the method.

For example:
for instance methods.
parameters that refer to types.
parameters.
This attribute is used in those instances where the should be allowed to escape.

Applying this attribute, in any form, has impact on consumers of the applicable API. It is necessary for API authors to understand the lifetime implications of applying this attribute and how it may impact their users.

member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.summary: Create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:System.Index.End
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsExternalInit

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ModuleInitializerAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that a method should be called in its containing module's initializer.
member.remarks:
When one or more valid methods with this attribute are found in a compilation, the compiler will emit a module initializer which calls each of the attributed methods.
Certain requirements are imposed on any method targeted with this attribute: - The method must be `static`. - The method must be an ordinary member method, as opposed to a property accessor, constructor, local function, etc. - The method must be parameterless. - The method must return `void`. - The method must not be generic or be contained in a generic type. - The method's effective accessibility must be `internal` or `public`.
The specification for module initializers in the .NET runtime can be found here: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/design/specs/Ecma-335-Augments.md#module-initializer
